ref_docs.title: User_Guide_Placing_Orders.html
ref_docs.comment: This document provides instructions on how to place orders in the trading system, including order types and execution steps.

ref_docs.title: Trade.java
ref_docs.comment: This code defines the Trade class, which encapsulates the details of a trade execution in the trading system.

conversations.ai_assistant:
A trade represents a confirmed execution of an order. It typically includes:

- **tradeId**: unique identifier for the execution  
- **orderId**: link back to the originating order  
- **security**: the instrument traded  
- **side**: BUY, SELL, or SELL SHORT  
- **quantity** and **price**: what was executed  
- **tradeDate**: timestamp of execution  

In this system, a trade is created after the market accepts and executes the order.
A **trade** is the executed result of an order. In this system it records the trade ID, related order ID, security, side, quantity, executed price, and the execution timestamp.
